Package controller

Class Customers

java.lang.Object
controller.Customers
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class Customers extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controller for the Customer GUI of the application.

This class is responsible for handling all user interactions on the Customer GUI, including initializing the Customer table. The TableView contains a column which has a three dot button that was added programmatically to the table.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • setupOptionsColumn

      private void setupOptionsColumn()
      Configures the options column in the customer table with buttons for each row. These buttons are set up with icons and actions that open a context menu offering options to edit or delete the customer. The method defines a cell factory for the table column that creates a new cell containing a button with a predefined icon.

    • showOptionsMenu

      private void showOptionsMenu(Customer customer, javafx.scene.control.Button button)
      Displays a context menu for editing or deleting the specified customer. The menu is triggered from a button within the customer table and provides the options "Edit" and "Delete".
      Parameters:
      customer - The customer instance associated with the selected row in the table.
      button - The button used to trigger the context menu, ensuring it appears adjacent to the button.

    • editCustomer

      private void editCustomer(Customer customer)
      Initiates the process of editing the given customer's details. This method displays the customer editing form in the central pane of the main application window.
      Parameters:
      customer - The customer to be edited.

    • deleteCustomer

      private void deleteCustomer(Customer customer) throws SQLException
      Initiates the deletion of the specified customer after confirmation. An alert dialog asks for confirmation, and if confirmed, the customer is deleted from the database, and the customer view is refreshed.
      Parameters:
      customer - The customer to be deleted.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • onAddCustomer

      public void onAddCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles the action triggered by the 'Add Customer' button. This method loads the customer addition form into the central pane of the main application window.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggered by the button click.
